title: Frame Transaction
description: Add a new transaction type whose validity and gas payment can be defined abstractly. Instead of relying solely on a single ECDSA signature, accounts may freely define and interpret their signature scheme using any cryptographic system.
author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), lightclient (@lightclient), Felix Lange (@fjl), Yoav Weiss (@yoavw), Alex Forshtat (@forshtat), Dror Tirosh (@drortirosh), Shahaf Nacson (@shahafn)
laymanDescription: A new transaction type that lets accounts use any cryptographic signature scheme instead of just ECDSA. This enables post-quantum security, flexible smart wallets with features like social recovery and spending limits, and native gas sponsorship.

improveUX.description: Enables native account abstraction with flexible wallets supporting social recovery, multi-sig, spending limits, and gas sponsorship without intermediaries.

endUsers.description: Better wallet UX with flexible security options and ability to have transactions sponsored by others.

appDevs.description: Can leverage native AA infrastructure for easier user onboarding and advanced wallet features.

walletDevs.description: Must implement new transaction type and validation logic, but gain native AA capabilities without bundler dependency.

toolingInfra.description: Need to support new transaction type and receipt format with per-frame receipts.

layer2s.description: Can adopt same AA model for cross-chain interoperability.

stakersNodes.description: New mempool validation rules required for frame transactions.

elClients.description: Significant implementation: new transaction type, 4 new opcodes, frame execution model, and mempool validation rules.

benefits: Provides migration path away from ECDSA to post-quantum secure signatures
Native account abstraction without bundler intermediaries
Flexible gas sponsorship and ERC-20 fee payments
Synergy with FOCIL for censorship-resistant privacy transactions
tradeoffs: New mempool DoS vectors require ERC-7562-style validation restrictions
ORIGIN opcode behavior changes for frame transactions
